parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets an object's damage value in the range 0..1, 0 meaning fully functional and 1 completely destroyed / dead.<br>
The alternative syntax allows to switch off destruction effects.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Identical to [[setDammage]], typo aside.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[setDamage]] damage

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> damage: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> object [[setDamage]] [damage, useEffects] <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.67</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [damage, useEffects]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> damage: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> useEffects: [[Boolean]] - [[false]] to skip destruction effects. Default: [[true]]

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldier1 [[setDamage]] 1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_house1 [[setDamage]] [1, [[false]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setVehicleArmor]], [[damage]], [[getDammage]], [[setHit]], [[getHit]], [[getHitIndex]], [[setHitIndex]], [[getHitPointDamage]], [[setHitPointDamage]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 29, 2015 - 11:23 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:KamikazeXeX|KamikazeXeX]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Using this possible overrides individual hit damages such as [[setHitPointDamage]] ["HitHead", _value]; if you're having issues try setting hitdamage ''after'' setdamage.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 17, 2006‎ - 07:36 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Fragorl|Fragorl]]</dt>
<dd class="note">In '''OFP''', setting a unit's damage to a negative value will set it is health to full, but impair their aim.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
